uk.gov.gchq.palisade.config.service

Class ConfigUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.config.service.ConfigUtils

  • public final class ConfigUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class that includes functionality to create a Service from a given class name.

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveConfigurationPath

        public static java.lang.String retrieveConfigurationPath()
        Retrieves the path to the file that describes how to connect to the Palisade configuration service. This should be in an environment variable named ConfigConsts.CONFIG_SERVICE_PATH.
        Returns:
        the configuration service file path
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the environment variable is not set

      • retrieveBootstrapPath

        public static java.lang.String retrieveBootstrapPath()
        Retrieves the path to the file that describes how to connect to the Palisade cache service back-end. This should be in an environment variable OR Java system property named ConfigConsts.BOOTSTRAP_CONFIG. This method should only be used by the internal ConfigurationService, not by clients. Clients are directed to the retrieveConfigurationPath() method.
        Returns:
        the cache service file path
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if neither the environment variable or system property are set

      • createService

        public static <S extends Service> S createService(java.lang.Class<?> resolverClass,
                                                  java.lang.String configDetailsPath,
                                                  java.lang.Class<S> serviceClass,
                                                  java.lang.String... overridable)
                                           throws NoConfigException
        Attempts to create the configured Service. This method provides the boot strapping for the REST services to instantiate their services to which they delegate the actual implementations. This method will attempt to load the ConfigurationService class details from the given path. Once this has been instantiated, it will call the configuration service trying to get the name of the actual implementing class for the given service and then configure it.
        Type Parameters:
        S - type of service being returned
        Parameters:
        resolverClass - the class to resolve the configDetailsPath against
        configDetailsPath - the path to the configuration JSON, either on the file system or in a JAR
        serviceClass - the type of service to create and configure
        overridable - list of regular expressions for keys that can be overridden from system properties
        Returns:
        an instantiated configured service
        Throws:
        NoConfigException - if the configuration service could not find any configuration
        See Also:
        Configurator.createFromConfig(Class, uk.gov.gchq.palisade.service.ServiceState, String...)

      • createConfigServiceFromPath

        public static ConfigurationService createConfigServiceFromPath(java.lang.Class<?> resolverClass,
                                                               java.lang.String configDetailsPath)
        Create a ConfigurationService from the JSON serialised form. Attempts to create the service by loading the given path either from the classpath or from a file system path. If this succeeds then the service instance is created by de-serialising it from the JSON in the opened file.
        Parameters:
        resolverClass - the class to resolve the file against when searching in the classpath
        configDetailsPath - the path to the configuration file
        Returns:
        a configuration service instance
        See Also:
        Class.getResourceAsStream(String), StreamUtil.openStream(Class, String)

      • retrieveConfig

        public static ServiceState retrieveConfig(java.lang.Class<?> resolverClass,
                                          java.lang.String configDetailsPath,
                                          java.lang.Class<? extends Service> serviceClass)
        Retrieve the ServiceState for the named service class. This method will attempt to load the ConfigurationService class details from the given path. Once this has been instantiated, it will repeatedly call the configuration service trying to get the details for the given service.
        Parameters:
        resolverClass - the class to resolve the configDetailsPath against
        configDetailsPath - the path to the configuration JSON, either on the file system or in a JAR
        serviceClass - the type of service to retrieve the configuration for
        Returns:
        the service configuration for a class
        See Also:
        Configurator.retrieveConfig(Optional)
